column4: 우리의 주된 목적은 (이 삶에서) / 다른 사람들을 돕는 것이다.
column5: {{c1::Our prime purpose in this life is to help others.}}
column6: our prime purpose / in this life / is / to help / others

column4: 가장 저렴한 교육은 / 실수로부터 배우는 것이다 (다른 사람들의).
column5: {{c1::The least expensive education is learning from the mistakes of others.}}
column6: the least expensive education / is / learning / from the mistakes of others

column4: 의무는 (법원 제도의) / 권리를 보호하는 것이다 (국민의).
column5: {{c1::The duty of the court system is to protect the rights of the people.}}
column6: the duty of the court system / is / to protect / the rights of the people

column4: 모든 일은 [당신이 해야 할] / 당신의 틀에 박힌 일상에 조금 변화를 주는 것이다.
column5: {{c1::All you have to do is (to) vary your routine a little.}}
column6: all / you / have to / do / is / (to) vary / your routine / a little

column4: 누군가를 용서하는 것은 / 그들의 관점에서 보려고 노력하는 것이다.
column5: {{c1::Forgiving someone is trying to look at things from their perspective.}}
column6: forgiving someone / is / trying / to look at things / from their perspective

column4: 목표를 세워라 // 그리고 계속해서 앞으로 나아가라.
column5: {{c1::Set your goal and keep moving forward.}}
column6: set / your goal / and / keep / moving / forward

column4: 당신은 집중한 채로 있어야 한다 / 일과에.
column5: {{c1::You should stay focused on the daily tasks.}}
column6: you / should stay / focused / on the daily tasks

column4: 미스터리는 (스톤헨지를 둘러싼) / 풀리지 않은 채로 남아 있다.
column5: {{c1::The mysteries surrounding Stonehenge remain unsolved.}}
column6: the mysteries / surrounding Stonehenge / remain / unsolved

column4: 내 요점은 ~이다 // 우리가 너무 많은 시간을 쓰고 있다는 것 / 세부적인 것에.
column5: {{c1::My point is that we’re spending too much time on details.}}
column6: my point / is / that / we’re / spending / too much time on details

column4: 문제는 ~이다 // 우리가 죽을 것인지가 아니라, / 우리가 어떻게 살 것인지.
column5: {{c1::The question is not whether we will die, but how we will live.}}
column6: the question / is not / whether / we will die / but / how / we will live

column4: 최대 관심사는 (학생들 사이에서) / ~이다 // 누가 그들의 담임 선생님이 될지.
column5: {{c1::223 The hot topic among students is who is going to be their homeroom teacher.}}
column6: the hot topic / among students / is / who / is going to / be / their homeroom teacher

column4: 하나는 (가장 힘든 선택들 중애 (인생에서)) / ~이다 // 어느 다리를 우리가 건너야 하는지.
column5: {{c1::One of the hardest choices in life is which bridge we should cross.}}
column6: one of the hardest choices / in life / is / which / bridge / we / should / cross

column4: 첫 번째 교육은 (운전에 있어) /~이다 // 어떻게 네가 차에 시동을 거는가.
column5: {{c1::The first lesson in driving is how you start the car.}}
column6: the first lesson / in driving / is / how / you / start / the car

column4: 우리는 인생의 가장 좋은 교훈을 배우는 것 같다 / 가장 힘든 때에.
column5: {{c1::We seem to learn life’s best lessons at the worst times.}}
column6: we / seem / to learn / life’s best lessons / at the worst times

column4: 그는 긴장하는 것 같지 않았다, / 큰 경기 전에도.
column5: {{c1::He didn’t appear (to be) nervous, even before the big match.}}
column6: he / didn’t / appear / (to be) nervous / even before / the big match

column4: 기후 문제를 해결하는 것은 / 하나의 도전으로 판명되었다.
column5: {{c1::Solving the climate problem has proved to be a challenge.}}
column6: solving / the climate problem / has / proved / to / be / a challenge

column4: 영화에서, / 때때로 / 가장 예상치 못한 인물이 / 악당으로 판명된다.
column5: {{c1::In a film, sometimes the least-expected person turns out to be the villain.}}
column6: in a film / sometimes / the least-expected person / turns out / to / be / the villain

column4: 우리는 사람들을 알아가지 않는다 / 그들이 우리에게 올 때. // 우리는 그들에게 다가가야 한 다 / 그들이 어떤 사람인지 알아내기 위해서.
column5: {{c1::We don’t get to know people when they come to us; we must go to them to find out what they are like.}}
column6: we / don’t get to know / people / when / they / come to us / we / must go / to them / to find out / what / they are like

column4: 우리는 우연히 발견하게 됐다 // 우리가 몇 가지 공통점이 있다는 것을.
column5: {{c1::We happened to discover we had a few things in common.}}
column6: we / happened / to / discover / we / had / a few things in common

column4: 나는 원한다 / 내 삶이 긍정적인 영향을 미치기를 / 다른 사람들에게.
column5: {{c1::I want my life to have a positive influence on others.}}
column6: I / want / my life / to / have a positive influence / on others

column4: 부모들은 종종 기대한다 / 자녀들이 / 더 잘하기를 / 자신들이 했던 것보다.
column5: {{c1::Parents often expect their children to do better than they did.}}
column6: parents / often / expect / their children / to do / better than / they did

column4: 진정한 친구는 절대로 요청하지 않는다 / 당신이 / 천사처럼 행동하도록. 그 대신에, 그가 당신 의 천사가 된다.
column5: {{c1::A true friend never asks you to act like an angel. Instead, he becomes your angel.}}
column6: a true friend / never / asks / you / to act / like an angel / Instead / he / becomes / your angel

column4: 판사는 명령할 수 있다 / 네가 / 최대 1,000달러의 벌금을 내도록.
column5: {{c1::The judge can order you to pay a maximum fine amount of $1,000.}}
column6: the judge / can order / you / to pay / a maximum fine amount of $1,000

column4: 허락하라/ 당신의 열정이 / 당신의 목적이 되게, // 그러면 그것은 당신의 직업이 될 것이다 / 언젠가.
column5: {{c1::Allow your passion to become your purpose, and it will become your profession one day.}}
column6: allow / your passion / to become / your purpose / and / it / will become / your profession / one day

column4: 경험은 (~하도록) 한다 / 당신이 / 실수를 알아차리도록 // 그것(실수)을 다시 저질렀을 때.
column5: {{c1::Experience enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.}}
column6: experience / enables / you / to recognize / a mistake / when / you / make / it again

column4: 혼자 있는 시간은 어쩔 수 없이 (~하도록) 한다 / 당신이 / 휴식을 취하도록 / 일상적인 책임에 서 벗어나.
column5: {{c1::Alone time forces you to take a break from everyday responsibilities.}}
column6: alone time / forces / you / to take a break / from / everyday responsibilities

column4: 그는 설득했다 / 내가 / 고기를 덜 먹거나 / 한번 채식주의자가 되어 보라고.
column5: {{c1::He persuaded me to eat less meat or try going vegetarian.}}
column6: he / persuaded / me / to eat / less meat / or / try / going / vegetarian

column4: 강한 지도자는 격려해준다 / 네가 / 자신의 이익을 위해 행동하도록, / 단지 그들의 것(=지도자 들의 이익)을 위해서가 아니라.
column5: {{c1::Strong leaders encourage you to do things for your own benefit, not just theirs.}}
column6: strong leaders / encourage / you / to do / things / for your own benefit / not just theirs

column4: 계속되는 폭우는 유발한다 / 가격이 (채소의) / 폭등하도록
column5: {{c1::The continuous heavy rain causes the price of vegetables to rise sharply.}}
column6: the continuous heavy rain / causes / the price of vegetables / to rise sharply

column4: 그 후기는 (~하도록) 했다/ 내가 / 생각하도록 // 그 호텔이 초과예약 문제가 있다고.
column5: {{c1::The review led me to believe that the hotel had an overbooking problem.}}
column6: the review / led / me / to believe / that / the hotel / had / an overbooking problem

column4: 치과의사들은 충고한다 / 우리가 / 칫솔을 교체하도록 / 석 달마다.
column5: {{c1::Dentists advise us to replace our toothbrushes every three months.}}
column6: dentists / advise / us / to replace / our toothbrushes / every three months

column4: 상기시켜라 / 네 자신이 / 스스로의 판단을 신뢰하도록 // 상황이 잘못 돌아갈 때.
column5: {{c1::Remind yourself to trust your own judgments when things go wrong.}}
column6: remind / yourself / to trust / your own judgments / when / things / go wrong

column4: 외무부 장관은 경고한다 / 국민들이 / (~한) 나라들을 여행하지 말도록 [테러리스트 공격이 있 을 것 같은].
column5: {{c1::The Foreign Minister warns citizens not to travel to countries that are likely to have terrorist attacks.}}
column6: the Foreign Minister / warns / citizens / not to / travel to countries / that / are likely to / have terrorist attacks

column4: 적당한 양의 스트레스는 (~하도록) 한다 / 우리가 최고의 상태에서 일을 해내도록.
column5: {{c1::A moderate amount of stress gets us to perform at our best.}}
column6: a moderate amount of stress / gets / us / to perform / at our best

column4: 하루하루를 세지 마라. 하루하루를 중요하게 만들어라.
column5: {{c1::Don’t count the days. Make the days count.}}
column6: don’t count / the days / Make / the days / count

column4: 수백만 명이 사과가 떨어지는 것을 보았다, // 하지만 뉴턴은 (~한) 사람이었다 [왜 그런지를 물은].
column5: {{c1::Millions saw the apple fall, but Newton was the one who asked why.}}
column6: millions / saw / the apple fall / but / Newton / was / the one / who / asked / why

column4: 선생님이 시키셨다 / 학생들이 / 그 이야기를 요약하도록 / 200자 미만으로.
column5: {{c1::The teacher had students summarize the story in less than 200 words.}}
column6: the teacher / had / students / summarize / the story / in / less than 200 words

column4: 절대 두지 마라 / 당신의 감정이 / 당신의 지성을 압도하게.
column5: {{c1::Never let your emotions overpower your intelligence.}}
column6: never / let / your emotions / overpower / your intelligence

column4: 당신은 쉽게 관찰할 수 있다 / 사람들이 / 휴대폰을 사용하는 것을 / 지하철에서.
column5: {{c1::You can easily observe people use their cell phones in the subway.}}
column6: you / can / easily observe / people / use / their cell phones / in the subway

column4: 나는 한 번도 들어본 일이 없다 / 나의 부모님이 / 나쁜 말씀을 하시는 것을 (누구에 대해서도).
column5: {{c1::I’ve never heard my parents say a bad word about anybody.}}
column6: I’ve / never / heard / my parents / say / a bad word about anybody

column4: 봄에, / 당신은 느낄 수 있다 / 기온이 / 밤낮으로 크게 변하는 것을.
column5: {{c1::In spring, you can feel the temperature change a lot from night to day.}}
column6: in spring / you / can feel / the temperature / change / a lot / from night to day

column4: 다른 사람들이 그들의 꿈을 이루는 것을 도와라, // 그러면 너는 너의 꿈을 이룰 것이다.
column5: {{c1::Help others (to) achieve their dreams, and you will achieve yours.}}
column6: help / others / (to) achieve / their dreams / and / you / will achieve / yours

column4: 나는 지켜보았다 / 한 남자가 (메트로에 탄) / 전동차에서 내리려고 애쓰다가 실패하는 것을.
column5: {{c1::I watched a man on the Metro try to get off the train and fail.}}
column6: I / watched / a man / on the Metro / try / to get off / the train / and / fail

column4: 우리는 지켜보았다 / 태양이 바다 위로 떠오르고 있는 것을.
column5: {{c1::We watched the sun rising over the sea.}}
column6: we / watched / the sun / rising / over the sea

column4: 큰 지진 바로 직전에, / 그녀는 벽이 흔들리고 있는 것을 보았다.
column5: {{c1::Right before the large earthquake, she saw the walls shaking.}}
column6: right before / the large earthquake / she / saw / the walls / shaking

column4: 나는 느꼈다 / 내 심장이 더 빨리 뛰고 있는 것을 // 내가 알아차렸을 때 / 누군가가 나를 따 라오고 있는 것을.
column5: {{c1::I felt my heart beating faster when I noticed someone following me.}}
column6: I / felt / my heart / beating faster / when / I / noticed / someone / following me

column4: 우리가 누군가가 웃고 있는 것을 들을 때, // (~은) 거의 불가능하다 / 함께 웃기 시작하지 않 는 것은.
column5: {{c1::When we hear someone laughing, it is almost impossible not to begin laughing too.}}
column6: when / we / hear / someone / laughing / it / is / almost impossible / not to / begin / laughing too

column4: 때때로 / 두려움과 죄책감은 / 우리가 올바른 방향으로 걸어가기 시작하도록 한다.
column5: {{c1::Sometimes fear and guilt gets us walking on the right track.}}
column6: sometimes / fear and guilt / gets / us / walking on / the right track

column4: 독서는 당신이 계속해서 / (~)하도록 한다 / 빨리 생각하고 다른 이들보다 더 빨리 행동에 옮 기도록
column5: {{c1::Reading keeps you thinking fast and taking actions faster than others.}}
column6: reading / keeps / you / thinking fast / and / taking actions / faster than others

column4: 훌륭한 책은 / 당신이 계속 (~)하도록 할 것이다 / 모든 가능한 감정을 경험하도록.
column5: {{c1::A wonderful book will have you going through every possible emotion.}}
column6: a wonderful book / will have / you / going through / every possible emotion

column4: 기름진 음식은 소화를 느리게 할 수 있다 / 그리고 당신이 불편함을 느끼고 있는 채로 둘 수 있다.
column5: {{c1::Greasy foods can slow digestion and leave you feeling uncomfortable.}}
column6: greasy foods / can slow / digestion / and / leave / you / feeling uncomfortable

column4: 내가 사랑에 빠져 있을 때, // 나는 나 자신이 (~)하고 있는 것을 발견한다 / 전혀 아무 이유 없이 웃고 있는 것을.
column5: {{c1::When I’m in love, I find myself smiling for no reason at all.}}
column6: when / I’m in love / I / find / myself / smiling / for no reason / at all

column4: 나는 나만의 길을 걷는다. // 당신은 내가 (~)하고 있는 것을 결코 발견하지 못할 것이다 / 다 른 사람의 선례를 따르고 있는 것을.
column5: {{c1::I walk my own path; you will never catch me following in another’s footsteps.}}
column6: I / walk / my own path / you / will never catch / me / following / in another’s footsteps

column4: 나는 내 목소리가 들리게 할 수 없다 / 소음 때문에.
column5: {{c1::I can’t make my voice heard because of the noise.}}
column6: I / can’t make / my voice / heard / because of / the noise

column4: 우리는 들었다 / 우리 국가가 / 자랑스럽게 연주되는 것을 / 올림픽에서
column5: {{c1::We heard our national anthem played proudly at the Olympics.}}
column6: we / heard / our national anthem / played proudly / at the Olympics

column4: 사람들은 더 정직해지는 경향이 있다 // 그들이 느낄 때 / 자신이 관찰된다고.
column5: {{c1::People are likely to be more honest when they feel themselves observed.}}
column6: people / are likely to / be / more honest / when / they / feel / themselves / observed

column4: 당신의 생각을 점검해 보아라, // 그러면 당신은 그것들이 (~)하다는 것을 알아챌 것이다 /과거 또는 미래로 가득 차 있다는 것을.
column5: {{c1::Examine your thoughts, and you will notice them filled with the past or the future.}}
column6: examine / your thoughts / and / you / will notice / them / filled with / the past or the future

column4: 일에 집중하는 것이 어려울 때, // 적절한 음악을 듣는 것은 / 당신이 계속 동기를 부여받게 할 수 있을 것이다.
column5: {{c1::When it’s hard to focus at work, listening to the appropriate music could keep you motivated.}}
column6: when / it’s hard / to focus at work / listening to / the appropriate music / could / keep / you / motivated

column4: 내가 너에게 줄게 / 몇 가지 조언을 (더 나은 에세이를 위한) [네가 주목받도록 해줄].
column5: {{c1::I’ll give you some tips for a better essay that will get you noticed.}}
column6: I’ll / give / you / some tips / for a better essay / that / will / get / you / noticed

column4: 언젠가, / 당신은 알게 될지도 모른다 / 자신이 / 향상된 것을 / 당신의 모든 노력에 의해.
column5: {{c1::Someday, you may find yourself improved by all your struggles.}}
column6: someday / you / may find / yourself / improved / by all your struggles

column4: 만약 당신의 달걀이 부화되기를 원한다면, // 그것들 위에 직접 앉아라.
column5: {{c1::If you want your eggs hatched, sit on them yourself.}}
column6: if / you / want / your eggs / hatched / sit on / them / yourself

column4: (~)하지 않도록 하라 / 네 자신이 / 세 가지 것들에 의해 통제되지 않도록 / 사람들, 돈 또는 과거의 경험들.
column5: {{c1::Don’t let yourself be controlled by three things: people, money, or past experiences.}}
column6: don’t let / yourself / be controlled / by three things: / people, money, or past experiences

column4: 취약한 보안 시스템은 (일부 웹사이트들의) / 사용자들의 개인 정보를 ~된 채로 두었다 / 해커 들에게 쉽게 노출된.
column5: {{c1::The weak security systems of some websites left users’ personal information easily exposed to hackers.}}
column6: the weak security systems of some websites / left / users’ personal information / easily / exposed / to hackers

column4: 당신이 에세이를 완성할 때, // 그것이 다른 사람에 의해 검토되게 하라.
column5: {{c1::When you complete your essay, have it reviewed by someone else.}}
column6: when / you / complete / your essay / have / it / reviewed / by someone else

column4: (~한) 일이 있나요 / 집에서 무언가를 도난당한?
column5: {{c1::Have you ever had something stolen from your house?}}
column6: have / you / ever / had / something / stolen / from your house?

column4: 나는 이미 스스로 (~한) 상태이다 / 내 가방들을 싸 둔 / 내일 여행을 위해.
column5: {{c1::I myself already have my bags packed for the trip tomorrow.}}
column6: I / myself / already / have / my bags / packed / for the trip tomorrow

column4: 우리는 시간이 없어서 (요리할), // 그래서 우리는 시켰다 / 음식이 배달되도록.
column5: {{c1::We had no time to cook, so we had some food delivered.}}
column6: we / had / no time / to cook / so / we / had / some food / delivered

column4: 집중 훈련 중에, / 그 달리기 주자는 / 발목이 부러졌다.
column5: {{c1::During the intense training, the runner had his ankle broken.}}
column6: during / the intense training / the runner / had / his ankle / broken

column4: 조심하십시오 / ~ (당하지) 않도록 / 소매치기를 당하지 / 많은 군중 속에서
column5: {{c1::Be careful not to have your pocket picked in a big crowd.}}
column6: be careful / not to / have / your pocket / picked / in a big crowd

column4: 그 축구 선수는 (~인) 상태이다 / 1년이 남아 있는 / 계약서상으로.
column5: {{c1::The soccer player has one year left on his contract.}}
column6: the soccer player / has / one year / left / on his contract

column4: 우리는 모든 것들이 완료되도록 할 수 없기 때문에 / 동시에, // 우선순위를 정해야 한다.
column5: {{c1::Because we cannot have everything completed all at once, we have to prioritize.}}
column6: because / we / cannot have / everything / completed / all at once / we / have to / prioritize

column4: 우리는 (~에) 살고 있다 / 시대에 (끊임없는 상호작용의).
column5: {{c1::We live in an age of constant interaction.}}
column6: we / live in / an age of constant interaction

column4: 그는 등산하러 간다 / 토요일마다.
column5: {{c1::He goes hiking every Saturday.}}
column6: he / goes / hiking / every Saturday

column4: 대부분의 행성은 자전한다 / 반시계방향으로.
column5: {{c1::Most planets rotate in an anticlockwise direction.}}
column6: most planets / rotate / in / an anticlockwise direction

column4: 채식주의자들은 고기를 피한다, / 닭고기와 생선을 포함하여.
column5: {{c1::Vegetarians stay away from meat, including chicken and fish.}}
column6: vegetarians / stay away / from meat / including / chicken and fish

column4: 새 지하철 노선은 / 다음 달에 개통될 것이다.
column5: {{c1::The new subway line opens next month.}}
column6: the new subway line / opens / next month

column4: 당신이 평범한 일을 할 때 / 평범하지 않은 방식으로, // 당신은 주목을 받을 것이다 (세상의).
column5: {{c1::When you do common things in an uncommon way, you will get the attention of the world.}}
column6: when / you / do / common things / in an uncommon way / you / will / get / the attention of the world

column4: 당신이 역경을 겪지 않는다면, // 당신을 모를 것이다 / 자신이 얼마나 강한지를.
column5: {{c1::If you don’t go through hardships, you won‘t know how strong you are.}}
column6: if / you / don’t go / through hardships / you / won‘t know / how strong / you are

column4: 당신이 꿈을 좇기 시작하자마자, // 모든 것이 (당신의 삶의) / 의미를 가질 것이다.
column5: {{c1::As soon as you start to pursue a dream, everything in your life will have meaning.}}
column6: as soon as / you / start / to pursue a dream / everything in your life / will have / meaning

column4: 너 자신을 존중해라 // 그러면 다른 사람들도 너를 존중할 것이다.
column5: {{c1::Respect yourself and others will respect you.}}
column6: respect / yourself / and / others / will / respect / you

column4: 성공한 사람은 / 자신의 실수에서 이익을 얻을 것이다 / 그리고 다시 시도할 것이다 / 다른 방 법으로.
column5: {{c1::The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.}}
column6: the successful man / will / profit / from his mistakes / and / try again / in a different way

column4: 이번 주에 / 나는 ~에 집중하려고 한다 / 학교 공부에 [내가 따라잡아야 할].
column5: {{c1::This week I’m going to concentrate on schoolwork that I need to catch up on.}}
column6: this week / I’m going to / concentrate / on schoolwork / that / I / need / to catch up on

column4: 우리는 이사할 것이다 / 새로운 곳으로 / 내일.
column5: {{c1::We are moving to a new place tomorrow.}}
column6: we / are moving / to / a new place tomorrow

column4: 많은 사람들이 포기한다 // 자신들이 막 성공을 달성하기 직전에
column5: {{c1::A lot of people give up just before they’re about to achieve success.}}
column6: a lot of people / give up / just before / they’re / about to / achieve / success

column4: 그녀는 막 떠나려는 참이었다 // 그가 마침내 도착했을 때.
column5: {{c1::She was on the point of leaving when he finally arrived.}}
column6: she / was / on the point of / leaving / when / he / finally / arrived

column4: 비행기는 (토론토로 가는) / 이륙할 것이다 / 30분 이내에.
column5: {{c1::The plane for Toronto is to take off within 30 minutes.}}
column6: the plane for Toronto / is / to take off / within 30 minutes

column4: 그 프로젝트는 시작하기로 되어 있다 / 월요일에 // 그리고 기간은 3주일 것이다.
column5: {{c1::The project is due to start on Monday and the duration will be three weeks.}}
column6: the project / is / due / to start / on Monday / and / the duration / will be / three weeks

column4: 사람들은 궁금해했다 / 수 세기 동안 / 사후 세계에 대해.
column5: {{c1::People have wondered for centuries about life after death.}}
column6: people / have wondered / for centuries / about life / after death

column4: 우리는 제주도에 가본 일이 있다 / 여러 번
column5: {{c1::We have been to Jeju Island many times.}}
column6: we / have / been / to Jeju Island / many times

column4: 우리는 막 제주도에 다녀왔다 / 여름휴가로.
column5: {{c1::We have just been to Jeju Island for summer vacation.}}
column6: we / have just / been / to Jeju Island / for / summer vacation

column4: 남아프리카는 / 많은 자연유적들을 잃어왔다 / 사막화로 인해서.
column5: {{c1::South Africa has lost many natural habitats due to deforestation.}}
column6: South Africa / has / lost / many natural habitats / due to / deforestation

column4: 1985년 이래로, / 그 회사는 현재 위치에 있어 왔다.
column5: {{c1::Since 1985, the company has been in its present location.}}
column6: since / 1985 / the company / has / been / in / its present location

column4: 내 일생의 꿈이었다 / 이 아름다운 도시를 방문하는 것이.
column5: {{c1::It has been my lifelong dream to visit this beautiful city.}}
column6: it / has / been / my lifelong dream / to visit / this beautiful city

column4: 너는 언젠가 상상해본 일이 있니 / 너의 미래를?
column5: {{c1::Have you ever imagined your future?}}
column6: have / you / ever / imagined / your future?

column4: 그 야구팀은 / 지금까지 한 번도 승리하지 못했다 / 올 시즌에.
column5: {{c1::The baseball team has never won a game so far this season.}}
column6: the baseball team / has / never / won / a game / so far / this season

column4: 그녀는 겨우 스무 살이다, // 하지만 그녀는 이미 얻었다 / 세계적인 명성을.
column5: {{c1::She’s only twenty, but she’s already achieved worldwide fame.}}
column6: she’s / only twenty / but / she’s / already achieved / worldwide fame

column4: 그는 방금 (~이) 되었다 / 회원이 (멘사의) / 156이라는 추정 IQ로.
column5: {{c1::He has just become a member of Mensa, with an estimated IQ of 156.}}
column6: he / has / just become / a member of Mensa / with an estimated IQ of 156

column4: 내 여동생은 은행에 갔다.(그 결과 지금 여기에 없다.) 그녀는 곧 돌아올 것이다.
column5: {{c1::My sister has gone to the bank. She should be back soon.}}
column6: my sister / has / gone / to the bank / She / should be / back soon

column4: 누군가가 앉아 있다 / 그늘에 / 오늘날 // (다른) 누군가가 나무를 심었기 때문에 / 오래 전에.
column5: {{c1::Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.}}
column6: someone / is / sitting / in the shade today / because / someone / planted / a tree / a long time ago

column4: N 서울 타워는 서울의 상징이어 왔다 // 그것이 처음으로 개방된 이래로 / 대중에게 / 1980년에.
column5: {{c1::N Seoul Tower has been a symbol of Seoul since it first opened to the public in 1980.}}
column6: N Seoul Tower / has / been / a symbol of Seoul / since / it / first opened / to the public / in 1980

column4: 그 아기는 (계속) 울고 있다 // 우리가 여기에 온 이후로.
column5: {{c1::The baby has been crying since we got here.}}
column6: the baby / has / been / crying / since / we / got here

column4: 얼마나 오랫동안 (계속) 일자리를 찾아왔습니까?
column5: {{c1::How long have you been looking for a job?}}
column6: how long / have / you / been / looking for a job?

column4: 나는 이 문제를 해결하려 (계속) 노력하고 있다 / 오후 내내. 쉴 시간이다.

column6: I / have / been / trying / to solve / this problem / all afternoon / It’s time for a break

column4: 그 행사는 (계속) 개최되고 있다 / 그 도시에서 / 5월 첫째 주 토요일에 / 매년.
column5: {{c1::The event has been taking place in the city on the first Saturday of May each year.}}
column6: the event / has / been / taking place / in the city / on the first Saturday of May / each year

column4: 그 피아니스트는 아팠다 / 2주 동안, // 그래서 그녀는 참가할 수 없었다 / 연주회에.
column5: {{c1::The pianist had been sick for two weeks, so she couldn’t take part in the concert.}}
column6: the pianist / had been / sick / for two weeks / so / she / couldn’t / take part / in the concert

column4: 나는 그를 즉시 알아봤다 // 내가 전에 그를 본 일이 있었기 때문에.
column5: {{c1::I recognized him at once because I had seen him before.}}
column6: I / recognized / him / at once / because / I / had / seen / him / before

column4: 내가 교실에 들어갔을 때, // 수업은 이미 끝나 있었다.
column5: {{c1::When I entered the classroom, the lesson had already finished.}}
column6: when / I / entered / the classroom / the lesson / had / already / finished

column4: 거의 11분이 지나갔다 // 선수들이 마침내 멈췄을 때 / 심판에게 이의를 제기하는 것을 / 그의 판정에 대해.
column5: {{c1::Almost 11 minutes had gone by when the players finally stopped challenging the referee over his decision.}}
column6: almost 11 minutes / had / gone by / when / the players / finally stopped / challenging / the referee / over his decision

column4: 캐롤은 선물을 준비했다 / 엄마를 위해 // 그런데 엄마는 자신의 평생을 희생하셨다 / 가족을 위해.
column5: {{c1::Carol prepared a gift for her mom, who had sacrificed all her life for her family.}}
column6: carol / prepared / a gift / for / her mom / who / had sacrificed / all her life / for her family

column4: 그녀는 대학을 졸업하게 될 것이다 / 다음 달에는.
column5: {{c1::She will have graduated from college by next month.}}
column6: she / will / have / graduated / from college / by next month

column4: 그녀는 영어를 죽 가르쳐온 것이 된다 / 10년 동안 / 내년이면.
column5: {{c1::She will have taught English for ten years by next year.}}
column6: she / will / have / taught / English / for ten years / by next year

column4: 만약 내가 이 영화를 한 번 더 보면, // 나는 그것을 세 번 보는 것이 될 것이다.
column5: {{c1::If I see this film once more, I will have seen it three times.}}
column6: if / I / see / this film / once more / I / will / have / seen / it / three times

column4: 우리는 차이를 극복하게 될 것이다 // 우리가 그것들을 존중한다면.
column5: {{c1::We will have overcome differences if we respect them.}}
column6: we / will / have / overcome / differences / if / we / respect / them

column5: {{c1::I am very satisfied to have tried many kinds of sports last year.}}
column6: I / am / very satisfied / to / have / tried / many kinds of sports / last year

column5: {{c1::He denied having made a serious mistake.}}
column6: he / denied / having / made / a serious mistake

column4: 농부는 주장했다 / UFO를 봤다고 / 하늘에서.
column5: {{c1::A farmer claimed to have seen a UFO in the sky.}}
column6: a farmer / claimed / to / have / seen / a UFO / in the sky

column4: (~은) 도움이 되었다 / 그 책을 복습했던 것은 // 내가 수업에 참석하기 전에.
column5: {{c1::It was helpful to have reviewed the book before I attended the history class.}}
column6: it / was helpful / to / have / reviewed / the book / before / I / attended / the history class

column4: 한 번 실패한 것이 / 의미하지는 않는다 // 당신이 실패하게 될 거라는 것을 / 모든 일에.
column5: {{c1::Having failed once doesn’t mean that you’re going to fail at everything.}}
column6: having / failed once / doesn’t mean / that / you’re / going to / fail / at everything

column6: I’m / pretty proud of / having / completed / a marathon / myself

column5: {{c1::John Bardeen is the only scientist to have received two Nobel Prizes in the Physics category.}}
column6: john Bardeen / is / the only scientist / to / have / received / two Nobel Prizes / in the Physics category
